verses.verse: The wise <S%H2450><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> builds <S%H1129><s%> her house, <S%H1004><s%> But the foolish <S%H200><s%> tears <S%H2040><s%> it down <S%H2040><s%> with her own hands. <S%H3027><s%>
He who walks <S%H1980><s%> in his uprightness <S%H3476><s%> fears <S%H3372><s%> the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> But he who is crooked <S%H3868><s%> in his ways <S%H1870><s%> despises <S%H959><s%> Him.
In the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of the foolish <S%H191><s%> is a rod <S%H2415><s%> for [his] back, <S%H1346><s%> But the lips <S%H8193><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> will preserve <S%H8104><s%> them.

Where no <S%H369><s%> oxen <S%H504><s%> are, the manger <S%H18><s%> is clean, <S%H1249><s%> But much <S%H7230><s%> increase <S%H8393><s%> [comes] by the strength <S%H3581><s%> of the ox. <S%H7794><s%>
A faithful <S%H529><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> will not lie, <S%H3576><s%> But a false <S%H8267><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> speaks <S%H6315><s%> lies. <S%H3577><s%>

A scoffer <S%H9238><s%> seeks <S%H1245><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and [finds] none, <S%H369><s%> But knowledge <S%H1847><s%> is easy <S%H7043><s%> to him who has <S%H995><s%> understanding. <S%H995><s%>
Leave <S%H1980><s%> the presence <S%H5048><s%> of a fool, <S%H3684><s%> Or you will not discern <S%H3045><s%> words <S%H8193><s%> of knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
The wisdom <S%H2451><s%> of the prudent <S%H6175><s%> is to understand <S%H995><s%> his way, <S%H1870><s%> But the folly <S%H200><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> is deceit. <S%H4820><s%>
Fools <S%H191><s%> mock <S%H9238><s%> at sin, <S%H817><s%> But among <S%H996><s%> the upright <S%H3477><s%> there is good <S%H7522><s%> will. <S%H7522><s%>
The heart <S%H3820><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> its own <S%H5315><s%> bitterness, <S%H4787><s%> And a stranger <S%H2114><s%> does not share <S%H6148><s%> its joy. <S%H8057><s%>
The house <S%H1004><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> will be destroyed, <S%H8045><s%> But the tent <S%H168><s%> of the upright <S%H3477><s%> will flourish. <S%H6524><s%>
There <S%H3426><s%> is a way <S%H1870><s%> [which seems] right <S%H3477><s%> to a man, <S%H376><s%> But its end <S%H319><s%> is the way <S%H1870><s%> of death. <S%H4194><s%>
Even <S%H1571><s%> in laughter <S%H7814><s%> the heart <S%H3820><s%> may be in pain, <S%H3510><s%> And the end <S%H319><s%> of joy <S%H8057><s%> may be grief. <S%H8424><s%>
The backslider <S%H5472><s%> in heart <S%H3820><s%> will have <S%H7646><s%> his fill <S%H7646><s%> of his own ways, But a good <S%H2896><s%> man <S%H376><s%> will [be satisfied] with his.
The naive <S%H6612><s%> believes <S%H539><s%> everything, <S%H3605><s%> But the prudent <S%H6175><s%> man <S%H6175><s%> considers <S%H995><s%> his steps. <S%H9036><s%>

A wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H2450><s%> is cautious <S%H3372><s%> and turns <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> from evil, <S%H9563><s%> But a fool <S%H3684><s%> is arrogant <S%H9378><s%> and careless. <S%H982><s%>
A quick-tempered man acts <S%H6213><s%> foolishly, <S%H200><s%> And a man <S%H376><s%> of evil <S%H4209><s%> devices <S%H4209><s%> is hated. <S%H8130><s%>
The naive <S%H6612><s%> inherit <S%H5157><s%> folly, <S%H200><s%> But the prudent <S%H6175><s%> are crowned <S%H3803><s%> with knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
The evil <S%H7451><s%> will bow <S%H7817><s%> down <S%H7817><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the good, <S%H2896><s%> And the wicked <S%H7563><s%> at the gates <S%H8179><s%> of the righteous. <S%H6662><s%>
The poor <S%H7326><s%> is hated <S%H8130><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> by his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> But those who love <S%H157><s%> the rich <S%H6223><s%> are many. <S%H7227><s%>
He who despises <S%H936><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> sins, <S%H2398><s%> But happy <S%H835><s%> is he who is gracious <S%H2603><s%> to the poor. <S%H6035><s%>

Will they not go <S%H8582><s%> astray <S%H8582><s%> who devise <S%H9177><s%> evil <S%H9563><s%>? But kindness <S%H2617><s%> and truth <S%H571><s%> [will be to] those who devise <S%H9177><s%> good. <S%H9185><s%>
In all <S%H3605><s%> labor <S%H6089><s%> there is profit, <S%H4195><s%> But mere <S%H8193><s%> talk <S%H1697><s%> [leads] only <S%H389><s%> to poverty. <S%H4270><s%>
The crown <S%H5850><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> is their riches, <S%H6239><s%> [But] the folly <S%H200><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> is foolishness. <S%H200><s%>
A truthful <S%H571><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> saves <S%H5337><s%> lives, <S%H5315><s%> But he who speaks <S%H6315><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> is treacherous. <S%H4820><s%>
In the fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> there is strong <S%H5797><s%> confidence, <S%H4009><s%> And his children <S%H1121><s%> will have <S%H1961><s%> refuge. <S%H4268><s%>
The fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is a fountain <S%H4726><s%> of life, <S%H9132><s%> That one may avoid <S%H5493><s%> the snares <S%H4170><s%> of death. <S%H4194><s%>
In a multitude <S%H7230><s%> of people <S%H5971><s%> is a king's glory, <S%H1927><s%> But in the dearth <S%H657><s%> of people <S%H3816><s%> is a prince's ruin. <S%H4288><s%>
He who <S%H750><s%> is slow <S%H750><s%> to anger <S%H639><s%> has great <S%H7227><s%> understanding, <S%H8394><s%> But he who <S%H7116><s%> is quick-tempered exalts <S%H7311><s%> folly. <S%H200><s%>
A tranquil <S%H4832><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> is life <S%H9132><s%> to the body, <S%H1320><s%> But passion <S%H7068><s%> is rottenness <S%H7538><s%> to the bones. <S%H6106><s%>
He who oppresses <S%H6231><s%> the poor <S%H1800><s%> reproaches <S%H2778><s%> his Maker, <S%H6213><s%> But he who is gracious <S%H2603><s%> to the needy <S%H34><s%> honors <S%H3513><s%> Him.

The wicked <S%H7563><s%> is thrust <S%H1760><s%> down <S%H1760><s%> by his wrongdoing, <S%H9567><s%> But the righteous <S%H6662><s%> has <S%H2620><s%> a refuge <S%H2620><s%> when he dies. <S%H4194><s%>

Wisdom <S%H2451><s%> rests <S%H5117><s%> in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of one who has <S%H995><s%> understanding, <S%H995><s%> But in the bosom <S%H7130><s%> of fools <S%H3684><s%> it is made <S%H3045><s%> known. <S%H3045><s%>
Righteousness <S%H6666><s%> exalts <S%H7311><s%> a nation, <S%H1471><s%> But sin <S%H9128><s%> is a disgrace <S%H9155><s%> to [any] people. <S%H3816><s%>
The king's favor <S%H7522><s%> is toward a servant <S%H5650><s%> who acts <S%H7919><s%> wisely, <S%H7919><s%> But his anger <S%H5678><s%> is toward him who acts <S%H954><s%> shamefully. <S%H954><s%>
